title: American_Top_40_1985_December_14th
description:
"You're hearing the nation's forty biggest hits. This is American Top 40, my name is Casey Kasem, and our countdown to the number one song in the land continues."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

There are 5 artists who appear on their own solo hits and also songs with other artists. Casey gives the details.

Casey explains why Jan Hammer (at number 34 with the Miami Vice Theme) decided to quit scoring the music for Miami Vice, an occupation which scored him a number one hit.

One artist in the countdown debuts with his 100th chart single!

A listener wants to know, "What are the five biggest albums of the 1970's?" Casey gives the list.

As of this countdown, only 9 acts have ever had three or more number one songs in a calendar year. The latest singer to achieve that distinction has a song in the top 10.

40:    Sex As A Weapon - Pat Benetar
39:    One Of The Living - Tina Turner
38:    Sun City - Artists United Against Apartheid        
37:    I'm Your Man - Wham!     
36:    You Are My Lady - Freddie Jackson

LDD: Just The Way You Are - Billy Joel
